definition: to administer/to manage/to hold in trust or escrow
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: Lawyers at the White House and for BP have been negotiating for days about an escrow account.
sentences.chinese: 白宮的律師應經和英國就建立代管帳戶事宜談判數日。

sentences.english: I didn’t do proper research on hosting companies.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有認真調查網站代管公司。

sentences.english: Payment is thru GAF escrow only.
sentences.chinese: 付款是通過GAF型代管而已。

sentences.english: All closing costs and pre-paids will be paid out of pocket at escrow.
sentences.chinese: 所有費用和閉幕前將自掏口袋低收入下午代管。

sentences.english: But the housemaid of that flank mama Zhou administer on behalf of Yi to answer again.
sentences.chinese: 但那旁邊的女僕周媽又代管伊答話。

sentences.english: Britain was mandated to govern the former colony of German East Africa .
sentences.chinese: 英國受權代管德國在東非的前殖民地。

definition: to receive sth on another's behalf
to pass on to sb/to carry and give to sb else
to belong to (a category)/to be attached to
to hold in safekeeping/to have in one's care/to guarantee/certainly/surely/custodian/curator
to assign/to allocate/to transfer (money to an account)
